Package com.mp3player.vdp

A virtual distributed platform (VDP) allows sharing of data and files between multiple machines.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Peer
    A virtual distributed network (VDP) consists of equals Peers.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Conflict  
    ConnectionEvent  
    DataChangeEvent  
    Distributed
    All objects that are shared among clients extend Distributed.
    RemoteFile
    A file or directory mounted on any Peer.
    VDP
    Main class for setting up a virtual distributed platform.

Package com.mp3player.vdp Description

A virtual distributed platform (VDP) allows sharing of data and files between multiple machines.

Each participating machine uses an instance of VDP to share data or allow file sharing. Connected machines are represented as Peers and can be obtained through the VDP class.

File sharing is enabled by peers making local files available to the network. This process is called mounting. All files mounted by one peer through one of VDP's mount methods are seen as root files. Directories implicitly mount all contained files and folders. Other peers can then access these files as RemoteFiles through the corresponding instance of Peer.

Data sharing allows synchronization of java objects across all peers. Each shared object must extend Distributed and has a unique ID. All shared data is available through the VDP. Changes made to one peer's instance are synchronized to all other peers by the library.

Messages can also be sent to a specific peer using Peer.send() and received using VDP.setOnMessageReceived().

Author:
API design: Philipp Holl
